characters: WHAT HAPPENS IS SID AND COTTON FIGHT TO THE FINISH, HE
IN THE ROPED OFF NEWS SECTION
OTHER UNTIL THEY BOTH DROP CENTER STAGE. THEY LAY NEXT
AND THAT'S AS FAR AS I'VE GOTTEN.
CHASES HER THROUGH HANGING FLATS, THEN DOWN THE FLY
HE STABS HER BACK. THEY FIGHT, CONTINUING TO STAB EACH
SUDDENLY, TWO HANDS LUNGE OUT OF THE DARKNESS
COTTON WEARY STANDING IN THE DOORFRAME
RAIL, BACK TO THE STAGE. SID GETS FINDS A KNIFE AND
"BASED ON THE BOOK "THE WOODSBORO MURDERS" BY GALE
SUDDENLY, A FIGURE APPEARS BEHIND HER. A HAND GRABS
TO EACH OTHER, NEITHER ABLE TO MOVE. THEIR EYES SLOWLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old preserved movie theatre. The kind only found in a small town. Very picturesque. The marquee in front reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line has formed around the block, GUYS and GIRLS - mostly college age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a girl, MAUREEN, no more than 18. A friendly face with innocent eyes. She stands in line with her boyfriend PHIL, same age. A handsome counterpart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be okay, baby, I'll hold your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we hurry, we can still catch the Sandra Bullock movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her close, snuggling with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen and Phil reach the box office, presenting their tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass through the front doors where an USHER stands randomly handing out GHOST MASKS. A Hollywood variation of a most familiar one. Phil takes one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The small theatre is nearly packed to capacity. Maureen and Phil enter, moving down the aisle searching for two seats. A YOUNG GIRL SCREAMS, whizzing by them as a GHOST MASKED GUY chases after her. The crowd LAUGHS. Everyone is having fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen and Phil find aisle seats down towards the screen just as the lights DIM. People FAKE SCREAM in terror. A very lively crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Credits roll as the movie begins. The studio logo appears followed by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen turns to find a GHOST MASK in her face. Phil has slipped it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil gets in her face, playing with her. She swats him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen looks behind her, toward the rest of the audience. A sea of white ghost faces fill the theatre. The publicity masks actually glow in the dark. A chilling sight that leaves Maureen extremely spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The movie begins. A house in the middle of nowhere. Lights burn from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the house, a YOUNG GIRL, Alicia Silverstonish is taking a shower. The water cascades over her nubile body. Suddenly, a FIGURE is glimpsed through the curtain. It's all very PSYCHO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now why does she have to be naked? How does that serve the plot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS. The young girl pulls the shower curtain aside to reveal a robe hung on a hook. She grabs it, running from the bathroom, into the living room, grabbing the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen is not having a good time. She's already spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you hang up on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why doesn't she just hang up and call the police? Stupid..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna pee. You want anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods. Maureen stands and moves up the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen emerges from the theatre and into the small lobby. It is dark and shadowed. She moves down a long hallway to a staircase. A "BATHROOM" sign with an arrow points downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small lounge leads to two bathroom doors. Very low lighting. Maureen descends the stairs, heading for the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large bathroom. Five stalls line one wall. The door CREAKS open. Maureen enters and shoots for a stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen finishes up, fastening her pants. Suddenly, the bathroom door CREAKS open. Maureen listens. FOOTSTEPS are heard. Loud and heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen eyes the crack in the stall door. Not much is visible. Suddenly, a SHADOW sweeps by. The footsteps stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen finishes up quickly. She flushes, throws the stall door open and rushes out to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stall doors are all closed. Maureen shoots for the door. She rips the door open as a FIGURE rushes her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG GIRL followed by her FRIEND, both perky and loud. They hurl past Maureen, LAUGHING and carrying on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got so scared my bladder rolled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You chicken shit. It's just a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it really happened. It's a true story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen is out the door. Now thoroughly spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone, Maureen moves for the stairs when a FIGURE emerges from the shadows. A GHOST MASKED SHAPE appearing behind her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUNGING FOR HER, grabbing her, spinning her around. She SCREAMS MADLY as the Ghost starts LAUGHING. The mask comes off. It's Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry but I had to. It was too easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil takes her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, baby. Lighten up a little, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get scared really easy, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta go with it. Scary movies are great foreplay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sincere. He leans down and plants a kiss on her. She caves, kissing him back. Sweet and sensual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just have a hard time with insipid, sexist violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can still Sandra Bullock it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandra started without us. We can stay. He kisses her again, then breaks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Okay. I gotta whizz. Meet me upstairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen moves up the stairs out of sight. Phil turns, reaching for the bathroom door just as a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GHOST MASKED FIGURE appears in his path. Phil steps back, surprised. Suddenly, a flash of silver shoots forth as Phil is pierced with a long sharp knife. Quick and silent. He bellies over just as the Ghost Shape strikes again. Phil goes down without a scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen is at the concession. A GIRL at the counter hands her change and Maureen is off with soda and a tub of popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREAMS and GASPS from the audience as the movie plays on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A patio chair comes flying through a glass door. The young girl in the movie tears off running, SCREAMING, flying through the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is really with the movie. Some even talk to the screen. "You dumb bitch. Get out of the house." etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen makes her way back to her aisle seat. She sits down next to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who sits with the mask on. The reflection from the movie bouncing against it in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down, with the popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many stabs did I miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl slips out a side door, completely terrified. In her hand, she holds a portable phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil turns to her, bringing his finger to his masked lips, SSSHHING her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl runs by a window. She looks in. A GHOST MASKED KILLER stares back. The Figure CRASHES through the window attacking her. She fights him off, getting away, running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the theater is SCREAMING. Maureen tries her best to detach herself from the movie. She eats her popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns her attention to Phil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil ignores her. She reaches over in the darkness putting her hand on his knee. She inches it up. The Ghost-masked Phil just stares ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsa the matter? Can't I get your ghost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl is running through the yard. The Ghost Killer is right behind her, chasing her... she SCREAMS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen pretends to watch the movie while her hand continues to move between Phil's legs. She stares ahead, WINCING at what's about to happen to the girl on screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't notice as Phil pulls a long sharp hunting knife from inside his coat jacket. Maureen's hand moves up Phil's jacket... something stops her. She feels something on her fingers... something wet. She pulls her hand back, the reflected movie illuminating bloody fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost advances on the young girl, grabbing her, pulling her to him, raising high a long, hunting knife. The young girl is helpless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen looks at Phil, confused... as if seeing for the first time... IT'S NOT PHIL. She pulls away when, the Ghost-masked Figure grabs her with one hand, the other one clutching the hunting knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen sees it, her mouth billowing forth a LOUD SCREAM that is matched by the entire audience as they SCREAM at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl is stabbed in the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen is helpless. The knife comes fast and furious, striking her in the stomach. She falls forward, into the aisle as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl, clutching her bloody chest... drags herself, crawling across wet grass... the killer behind her... raising his knife again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popcorn flies as Maureen falls forward, into the aisle, clutching her bloody stomach. She's speechless, unable to SCREAM. She holds her bloody hand out for all to see, begging for help. She stumbles down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone YELLS "Sit down." Maureen turns to several PEOPLE who begin to react. She turns behind her to see the Ghost Face coming at her again... knife raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl is slashed again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knife slices into Maureen again... then again. The theatre audience is starting to take note as the Ghost keeps slashing at her repeatedly with the knife. A horrifying, sickening sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen stumbles forward, her bloody body moving down to the front of the theater. Suddenly, the entire audience begins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen, swaying from side to side, turns to the crowd and emits a HORRENDOUS BLOOD CURDLING SCREAM as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young girl lets out an enormous EAR SCREECHING SCREAM that mirrors Maureen's as the killer attacks one last time, stabbing her, silencing her forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost slashes out one last time, direct and fierce. Maureen falls back against the movie screen... very much dead. Her arms flail across the screen... smearing blood over the wide screen image of the GHOST MASK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A typical college dorm room. Industrial strength furniture. There's two of everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RINGING phone stirs a YOUNG GIRL in bed, asleep under a mound of blankets and pillows. The girl starts to rise as the phone is answered. A VOICE is heard. Brass and sassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... uh-huh... Who is this? Well, we identify ourselves around here. No, you can't. Uh-huh... yeah, right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl rolls out of bed, her hair falls away to reveal her face - It's SIDNEY PRESCOTT. Two years older has brought a maturity to this beautiful young woman. Her face posses a survivor's edge. Stronger and more determined, she appears to have weathered the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her roommate and friend. An attractive young black woman. Twenty at most. Brazen. Fun. Full of life. She hands the phone to Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOICE spits out of the phone. Deep and haunting. Sidney doesn't flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney grabs a small device hooked to the phone. She takes a look at its display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot flash, Cory - prank phone calls are a criminal offense prosecuted under penal code 653M...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs the phone up, turning to Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah... I think it'll die off. It's opening weekend. Let's see how it goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney grabs her robe and shower bucket as Hallie channel surfs. Various morning news programs are on their small TV. Snippets are heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... The two victims, Maureen Evans and Phil Stevens..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The channel switches. A YOUNG MAN is being interviewed. Attractive, sullen. Sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I just wanna be left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice stops Sidney cold. She turns to the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sure gives a lot of interviews for someone who wants to be left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie hits the remote. The man's image disappears as the TV goes off. Hallie turns, all smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your ass in gear. You're late. Don't forget we've got rush at the Deltas tonight. Don't wear anything you don't want trashed. Sid? Sid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney turns from the television. Momentarily lost. Recovery is immediate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I let you talk me into going Greek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid moves to the door and throws it open. A GHOST FIGURE LEAPS at her. She SCREAMS but then stops herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a costume hung from her doorframe. Preset, to scare. Another prank. Sidney rips it down, turns to Hallie, throwing the costume at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid is surprisingly cool. She exits out the door, leaving Hallie staring at the Ghost Mask in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid steps outside of her dorm. The morning sun shines down as Sid breathes in, taking in the day just as FIFTY NEWS REPORTERS NOB HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, did you know the victims?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel responsible for the murders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Microphones are shoved in her face as Sidney is seiged upon by journalists and TV cameras. She starts to panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think there will be more murders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is mortified. She pushes and shoves but there is no escape. The questions come at her like lightning. She sees a whole in the crowd and goes for it as a REPORTER, a flashy woman - all hair and teeth, thick sunglasses, moves in her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you kill them last night, Sid? Has it gotten to you? Have you finally snapped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney's eyes flare. Her fist starts to clench when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! Someone beats her to it. A fist flies out from the crowd, connecting with the flashy woman's face. She drops. Sid spins around to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing, tight-fisted. Their eyes meet. A quick moment. Sidney is happy to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The onslaught continues. Cameras flash, reporters shove. Gale moves in front of Sid, holding the crowd at bay. The reporters begin to throw questions at Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go. l'll find you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid wastes no time. She takes off, running around the side of the building. She stops, takes a breath, but the reporters are on her tail. She looks up to see a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appear, moving towards her. It slows down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid goes for it as two hands reach out to help her. One smooth move and Sidney is in the arms of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him. Her face a book of questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at her. A safe, warm smile. His face as cute as ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security cart trots along, passing STUDENTS coming and going. Dressed smartly in a campus security outfit, Dewey maneuvers the cart across the campus grounds. Sidney rides beside him, horrified as she listens to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred people watched? Nobody did anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They thought it was a publicity stunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. How could it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know. It was carefully planned. Earlier in the day the victims received anonymous passes to the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a copycat killer I knew this would happen. That fucking movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cart comes to a stop in front of a building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As of now, they don't see any relation. But they're checking it out. The state, Special Task Force, FBI - they're all here. They'll find the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Sid, why don't you take off? Disappear for a few days. I'll come with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I will not crawl under a rock. This is a fucked-up world and people kill people all the time. I'll just get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey steps down off the security cart and helps Sid off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing will happen to you. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid's tough demeanor is cracking. She takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm here, right? We take care of each other. C'mon, I'll walk you to class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts off, for the first time, a severe limp is visible as his left leg drags behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go, it's all stairs, I can take it from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey, I'm completely equipped with mace, alarm whistle, keyring, knife, a degree in defensive combat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. This is nothing, Dewey. I'll be okay. Go back to work and let me get back to my quasi pseudo-happy existence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney reaches up and gives her pseudo-brother a kiss, then takes off for the building. Dewey watches until she disappears inside, then limps back to his security cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A newsvan pulls up and parks next to a trough of other newsvans and REPORTERS. Some are doing live remotes, others ready themselves for the next onslaught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale gets out of the newsvan, her cellular affixed to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... no one's talking. What's the studio's position? Never happen. They'd be stupid to pull the movie. With all this free press - they're gonna have huge numbers this weekend. It'll break box office records. Of course I have bumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale's CAMERAMAN can be seen behind her, in the van fussing with equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need two minutes at six o'clock. I wanna do a piece on the slain kids - no sympathy shit - let's stick with the movie angle. I wanna pull a clip from an old film...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale turns to her cameraman, snapping her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what was the name of that movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy looks up at her. It's RANDY. Two years older but still the charming jokester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE KNOWS YOU'RE ALONE. Yeah, find it. Don't worry, I've got it covered... I have a plan. Yeah, I'll get it. Give it a rest - I said I'll get it. Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up, turning to Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pressure's on. You ready for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm there, man. No worries. I got ya covered. I'm so there. That's why I'm here - because I'm there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy holds up his camera - stoked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney moves down a hallway. Not your typical school building. Through open doorways, film equipment is glimpsed. Editing bays and the like. She's in the Film Department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes upon an open door and peers in. A large room, a class is in progress. She slips in quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney takes a seat at the back of the room. A handful of FILM STUDENTS sit around on torn couches heavy in discussion. Sid goes unnoticed as she watches a whirlwind debate. A SNOTTY GUY is pontificating a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequels are too handicapped. By definition alone, they're inferior films.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie sits on a couch next to MICKEY, 20's, atheletic, cool and rowdy. Arms enwrapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit generalization. Many sequels have surpassed their original.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALIENS Far better than the original.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life's subjective. I much prefer Ridley Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversation overlaps, everyone arguing... making their point about ALIENS VS. ALIEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. ALIENS rocked. "Stay away from her - you bitch."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you that one. Name another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a hard-on for Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bigger budget does not make a better movie. TERMINATOR one is historical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone screams out, "You Sarah Connor?" as the TEACHER, a young artsy type, speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about THE GODFATHER PART II?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooohhh. The whole room goes worship silent. All in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG MAN, handsome and smooth, jumps into the conversation. His name is Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMPIRE STRIKES BACK. Smarter story. Improved effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the back of the room, Sidney watches him. Fixated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked JEDI. With the furry things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas and his Romper Room stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got. I got it. FRIDAY THE 13TH, PART 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case in point. The entire horror genre was destroyed by sequels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? And why do you think that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequels suck. Hello. It becomes about: money and no one's interested in quality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's more than that. Horror films are only as good as their villains. How can Freddie and Jason possibly be scary after they've been diluted through five or six sequels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the solution? If you were making a sequel today what would you do differently?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class stews on this. Derek turns, spotting Sidney in the back of the room. She gives a half wave. He starts for her, excusing himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point is - I made my point. Sequels suck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Sidney move out into the hallway. Derek throws his arms around her protectively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you? You weren't in class. I called as soon as I heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I skipped. Too many "That's her" looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, baby. What can I do'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask what you can do. No coddling. Life rolls on status quo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her with bedroom eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do that. And I can also do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves on her, wrapping her in his arms and kissing her passionately. She breaks away, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's a failed objection. He kisses her again and they're soon devouring each other like two people in love. Right in the middle of the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is a circus. The front steps of the student center have been roped off to form a platform. A podium and mike have been placed center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROWDS have gathered for the press conference that is being held by the university. Reporters and cameras have been roped off to the side. On stage, DEAN FISHER, a sharp looking woman in her forties is talking to spectators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAN FISHER (reading from a prepared statement)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... and we feel this unfortunate isolated tragedy in no way reflects upon our fine school and we should trust that the authorities and FBI are acting quickly to bring us answers..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beside her stand uniformed COPS, the local SHERIFF, FBI AGENTS. She continues on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale walks through the crowd, listening to the Dean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale? Can I have a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale spins around to find DEBBIE SALT, the flashy reporter who she decked earlier, standing in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry about the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Job hazard. Debbie Salt, stringer - NEWSWEEK. Answer a few questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? I thought you had retired from field reporting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman has immediately put Gale on the defensive. TWO OTHER REPORTERS have taken notice. Suddenly, CAMERAS are on Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know I'm dear to the subject matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And much richer as a result.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you? You look familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took your vulture seminar seminar at Berkeley last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in seconds the vultures are upon her as Gale Weathers is beseiged by REPORTERS. The questions spew forth. "Why are you here?" "Is this the work of a copycat killer?" "Have you talked to Sidney?" etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that Gale wanders off into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LOCAL SHERIFF, a smart looking guy in his 50's is fielding questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we have no evidence of a serial killer. We think the killer acted deliberately and not at random...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students and concerned faculty stand. Among them are Sidney, Derek, Hallie and Mickey. Next to them stand JOEL, 20's, black, sensible and friendly. A very intelligent face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what are they doing? He's talking but he's not saying anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like they don't know anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they'll cancel Hell Week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're getting nailed - you're not getting out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the way, two gorgeous sorority type girls, LOIS and MURPHY stand with their FRATERNITY JOCK BOYFRIENDS. All looks and attitude. Their eyes are on Sidney as they huddle in a conspiratory stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have they questioned you yet, Sid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has nothing to do with me, Joel. There's an estimated 270 serial killers currently active in the US at any given time. I can't control that. Who's hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie kicks him. Joel moves to Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta hit the library. Anatomy. Some of us have real majors. You gonna be okay, Sid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not allowed to ask that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stop by the Deltas tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel smiles, heading out as the two sorority girls, Lois and Murphy saunter over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly, Hallie stands at attention. Sidney joins begrudgingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sister Lois. Very much so. Thank you for asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. We need your help, pledges. Are you familiar with the Deltas TP fundraiser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pledges shake their heads. Suspicious. Lois withdraws two rolls of toilet paper from her book bag and passes them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In our efforts to raise money for our favorite cause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ne ask that you sell individual squares of toilet paper for a mere nickel a piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've set you each at a five dollar quota.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I getting fraternity interference, Mickey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I can peddle toilet paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No special treatment. I can do this. C'mon Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws him a comforting glance. She's okay with this. She heads off with Hallie. Derek watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you put up with this Greek shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's cool. Hallie's into it, I'm into Hallie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale moves through the crowd as the press conference/rally continues. She runs dead smack into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes meet. A long moment. The silence between them is revealing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been trying to reach you but you haven't returned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on crowd patrol, Miss Weathers, excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tips his hat curtly, then starts off. She stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns on her. His eyes on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Miss Weathers, your name is embedded clearly between my ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you read the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do retain reading skills. Shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And an explanation is, of course, out of the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 32. "Deputy Dewey filled the room with his dim-witted Barney Fifish presence." I think you've explained yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what you are is a money hungry, fame- seeking liar and - forgive me for saying - mediocre writer who has a cold storage shed where her heart should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have every right to be upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know my dim-witted inexperience isn't merely a subtle form of manipulation used to lower people's expectations thereby enhancing my ability to effectively maneuver within any given situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I don't know what else to say except I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm the one who's sorry. I misjudged you. Now if you'll excuse me, I have some oozing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey turns and limps away, leaving Gale staring after him. Her face smashed fiat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheriff continues fielding questions from reporters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, there has been no evidence that more than one killer is responsible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney and Hallie have split up. They move through the crowd selling toilet paper. Several STUDENTS make their purchase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney pockets her change, looks up to see Gale, standing alone. She goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. PEOPLE magazine won't stop calling but other than that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... you are the definition of mixed emotions. I really should hate you... I see your movie's getting good reviews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems to be causing a stir. What's with the toilet paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hell week. I'm pledging the Deltas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to see you involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. People have begun to notice the two of them talking. Reporters and spectators have slowly circled them. Gale looks around. She spots Randy, who appears behind Sid, with his camera. Gale gives him the nod. He throws the camera up, hits the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid spins around, surprised to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then she sees someone else, standing off to the side. A man she recognizes immediately. He looks at; her, his face sullen, broken. Sidney loses her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale motions to Randy. He maneuvers, getting the two of them in frame. A long moment, Sidney just stares at him. Completely off guard. She looks to Randy who aims the camera directly at her... filming her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back to Gale, staring holes through her, realizing she's been set up. She looks back to Cotton. She doesn't know what to say. She turns back to Gale. Eyes aflame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney storms off, disappearing in the crowd. Cotton turns to Gale. His face pained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was a mistake. I shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off, pushing through the crowd. Randy stops filming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is clearly not happy about his part in this. It's in his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to check your conscience at the door. We're not here to be loved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we don't anticipate another murder but we are taking every precaution possible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small street that dead-ends in a cul de sac. Large old homes populate it. Greek signs adorn the place. Welcome to Sorority Row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge living room. Divided sensibly in several sections. Nicely done. Et is empty except for one girl who lies on the couch watching television. This is CICI, pretty with a lively energy about her. She channel surfs while talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they broke up again. Bailey won't stop drinking and Sarah can't take it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he quit - the whole God thing - he has issues. The previews for next week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEP! BEEP! Call waiting bleeps through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up... someone's calling. (she clicks over) Chi Omega House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN'S VOICE. Deep and alluring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone who wants to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted? Where are you? Are you drinking? Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy's on the other line. He sounds drunk. I'll call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That shit. He only calls you when he's drunk. Don't go over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright... I'll call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Ted, you sound loaded. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry. My bad. I thought you were someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you want to speak with? Nobody's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're co-sponsoring the Acid Rain mixer at the Sig Ep. house tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm designated driver. I have to be here in case a sister calls and needs a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Drink with your brain." That's our motto. Who are you calling for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you wanna do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you always answer a question with a question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impatient. Look, do you wanna leave a message for someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you wanna die tonight, Cici ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost a whisper. Simple. Direct. His voice pierces Cici. Her eyes widen. BEEP! Call waiting CLICKS through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici gets up and moves to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici checks the front door, making sure it's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, some creep asshole trying to scare me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hell week. Chill. The movie murders have brought out the crazies. It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMP! A noise from upstairs. Cici spins around to the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMP! Something moves upstairs. It sounds almost like footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Cici moves to the staircase. She peers up it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRL ON PHONE (В… la Friday the 13th)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill, kill, kill, kill, hah, hah, hah, hah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're alone in that house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici looks up the staircase again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floorboards CREAK above her. Cici freaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flies to the door, unlocking it, throwing it open. She moves out onto the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wooden porch with a bulb glowing overhead. She stands on the porch steps, looking back, through the open door, into the house. The phone starts to CRACKLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're breaking up. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici looks up and down the street. A YOUNG GUY walks along the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy wears a headset, his head bobbing to the beat. He doesn't see her. Cici looks up the street to a sorority house down the block. Lights burn from within. People come and go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something going on at the Delta Zeta's. I'm gonna walk down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici moves further down the porch steps. The phone begins to CRACK severely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRL ON PHONE (phone begins to go out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that. Hang up... call... (static)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... campus security... send someone... check out... place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I'll call now. I'll call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici hangs up the phone. She hits the "TALK" button. Nothing but static. She tries again. She can't get a dial tone. She looks back to the front door. She hesitates quickly, debating, then she moves back up the porch steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries the phone again. It still won't connect. She moves back to the front porch. It connects. Major static. She dials 511.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, I'm calling from the Chi Omega...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I can't hear you. Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici eyes the open front door. She inches back to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici peers through the front door, into the house. It's completely empty. Cici steps back inside the house. The connection becomes much clearer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling from the Chi Omega house. Someone is harassing me. Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no one on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici spins around, SCREAMING BLOODY MURDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing before her is DAWNIE, a young girl, sweet, pre- occupied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you scared me. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to the mixer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to change. Did anyone call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some asshole trying to scare me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door remains wide open. The phone RINGS. Cici stares at it in her hand. She doesn't answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici nods, answering the phone. ROCK MUSIC BLARES from the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a ride. Taxi! Taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at Grogs and need a ride to Acid Rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? Is it Tina?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawnie grabs the phone, moving into the living room. She moves to a mirror and fusses with her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina, it's Dawnie. I'm on my way. Cici follows her back into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go. I don't mind. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawnie hangs up the phone, turning to Cici.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the next one. You should set the alarm. There's a killer on the loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reflected through the mirror is the foyer. Neither see as a SHROUDED FIGURE appears through the front door. Dawnie turns back to the mirror just as the Figure sweeps into the dark dining room and out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawnie starts back for the front door. The phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawnie throws her the phone and races out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your ill-concieved boyfriend. Seeya later. Set the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SLAMS the door shut behind her. A second later we hear it lock. Dawnie brings the phone up to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici nearly collapses. She's starting to lose it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget to set the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici hangs up, throwing the phone across the room. She moves back to the foyer where an alarm panel is positioned in the wail. She hits a coupla digits and a BEEP is heard as she activates the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She checks the door, making sure it's locked, then she turns and moves into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici finds the light switch. CLICK! The room is illuminated. Two long dining tables run the length of the room. It's empty. Void of the Figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, dark kitchen. Cici moves to the frig and opens it, She gives it the once over. The frig light reflects against her face. She closes the refrigerator, not seeing the Shadow that bounces across her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cici moves to a sliding glass door that overlooks the backyard. She checks the lock. Secure. Then, the phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to the phone that's attached to a nearby wall. It RINGS AGAIN. She reaches for it, answering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One finds her neck, the other grabs her by the hair, wrenching her head backwards and spinning her around, shoving her, pushing her into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass explodes everywhere, shattering to bits as Cici's body crashes through it, setting off the ALARM. A loud, shrill RING resonants through the house as Cici's body lands on the deck outside. Still. (NOTE: WES DOES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two doors down from Chi Omega. A big, old Gothic home serves as the Delta Zeta sorority. MUSIC PLAYS from inside. It sounds like a party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is filled with fifteen to twenty people. SORORITY GIRLS and FRAT BOYS who SCREAM and CHEER as they watch four girls who sit on their knees, hands behind their back, in front of a coffee table devouring plates of macaroni and cheese topped with whipped cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, Hallie, and two other girls, TERI and LUCE tear into the macaroni with all their might. Gobbling it up, making a mess of themselves. Mickey is next to Hallie, coaching her on. On Sid as she finishes her plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we have a winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid sits up. Macaroni and whipped cream is all over her face. She smiles the victor. Everyone APPLAUDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney gets to skip the next round of Bulimia bingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie, a face full of grime, eyes Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crack up. Someone passes her a towel. She stands wiping her face, looking across the room as Derek enters through the front door. She waves at, him. He hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been'? You missed my shining moment. I won the macaroni sundae binge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry honey. I got behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey is cleaning off Hallie's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to choke or anything but you're trailing. You need to pick the pace up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid and Derek stand arm in arm watching the next round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a FRAT BOY pops into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, guys, outside. Something's up at the Chi Omega. Police are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People begin to stand, moving to the windows and front door. Sidney looks to Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone comes flying out of the front door and into the yard as POLICE CARS WHIP BY. SIRENS BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two doors down sits the Chi Omega house crawling with police, ambulances, reporters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Yo - let's check it out." "C'mon." The entire crowd takes off in droves down the street. All except for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand on the porch, watching as the street becomes a circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Tyler, the Sheriff, police, FBI... the house is crawling. Dewey sifts around on his own, checking things out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Tyler and the Sheriff stand at the shattered glass door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of blood. But no body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff turns to his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Sid stand on the porch, his arms around her. Her face is numb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, indifferent, moves through the open front door, back inside the house. Her face and mind detached from what's going on. Derek remains on the porch, watching the spectacle. Slowly, the door behind him closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid moves through the living room, she grabs her coat when the phone RINGS. She looks at it suspiciously... knowingly... she reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VOICE. Low and haunting. Sidney closes her eyes. When she opens them tears are immediate But still, she refuses to crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To see every ounce of blood drain from your body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Voice has never sounded more evil... more seductive. Sidney doesn't flinch. She holds steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that Sidney hangs up the phone, SLAMMING it down. Silence. And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Voice comes from inside the room... behind her. Sidney spins around and finds herself staring at the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not the one from the movie theater. The one from Sidney's nightmare long ago. It stands in the foyer archway, staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sustained moment. A stand off. Sidney doesn't move. But then the killer withdraws his trademark. A long, steel hunting knife... blood stained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the GHOST LEAPS at her. She SCREAMS, dodging him,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek hears her SCREAM. He turns to the front door. He finds it locked. He starts to BEAT on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid just dodges the Ghost, just missing the knife's blade. She bolts through the living room, to the front door. Derek beats on it from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek. He's in the house. Help... me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles with the door, there are too many locks, the Ghost is already upon her. She looks to the stairs, thinks better of it... flies through the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek is going nuts trying to get into the house. He moves along the porch to the windows, looking through. He watches as the Ghost Figure chases her into the kitchen. Derek looks about the porch. He rears his foot back and kicks in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid moves through the kitchen to the back door. She struggles with the lock as the Ghost is right behind her. She barely makes it out the back door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, fenced in yard. Lots of big oak trees. Sid flies down the back porch and into the yard. She moves across it, passed trees and shrubs. She spots a closed fence door in the back of the yard. She looks behind her to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scans the yard, the Ghost Figure has completely disappeared. She moves behind a big tree, hiding behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid stops, catches her breath, then peers from behind the tree. The yard is completely empty. She goes for the fence door, slowly moving around the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMP! A noise in the darkness. She spins around, still making her way around the tree, moving backwards, walking right into a FIGURE. She SCREAMS, spinning around, finding herself face to face with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging, dangling, hung from the tree, her stomach a ripped, bloody mess. Sidney SCREAMS IN UNFORGETTABLE HORROR. She steps back, falling right into the arms of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's okay. It's just me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her into his arms, comforting her, as she holds on for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The early sun casts light upon an otherwise dark and joyless morning as the blood stained campus slowly comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The local campus security office has been converted into a media event. News trucks, cameras and REPORTERS stand guard outside while inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is packed. No longer just a campus security office. The place has been converted to the local police station as well as FBI headquarters. UNIFORMS and SUITS swarm the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a back section of the room, Sheriff Hartley and Captain Tyler are in a huge discussion with Dean Fisher. Tempers are heated. Its been a sleepless night for all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know if it's random. We haven't been able to connect the victims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first two were stabbed without thought. The sorority girl was gutted with autopsy precision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ! Just do something. I will not have a repeat of Gainesville. Not on my campus. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey listens to this exchange, slowly stepping forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer was trying to get to her. That sorority girl was a distraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer is obviously repeating Woodsboro. I can fill you in on what I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey is not a welcome participant. Eyes roll. Captain Tyler pulls Dewey aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, son. I know you've lived through this, but we got it under control. Why don't you have some coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Gale Weathers appears being ushered in by TWO UNIFORMS. Dean Fisher greets her with smiles The FBI and local police fawn over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Miss Weathers for coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, what can I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Tyler gives Dewey a patronizing pat on the back, sending him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were hoping you could help with the killer's profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey's face couldn't be more burned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chalk board in front of them. Three names are written on it under the label "Victims" - "MAUREEN EVANS, PHIL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale is at the chalk board

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maureen Evans - Maureen Prescott. Sidney Prescott's mother. The first victim in the Woodsboro Murders. Phil Stevens - Stephen Orth - the first kid to be murdered. Ten to one - Cici is not the third victim's real name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nickname Cassie or - Casey. The third victim in Woodsboro. She was hung from a tree and gutted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room goes quiet. Dewey watches from the back of the room. His eyes burning holes into Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a complete copycat. Your killer is even going in sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was the next victim in Woodsboro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the book or in the movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Himbry - the principal was the next victim. However, in the movie version, Tatum Riley was killed next. Dramatic license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. Captain Tyler flies out of his seat and into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find me every variation of Himbry and what was the other name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey speaks up. His voice soft but heard. The entire room stares at him, knowingly. Gale's eyes find his. He looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both on campus and the surrounding community. I want names ASAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room breaks into a fury as they jump into action. Gale stops Captain Tyler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Sidney? Is she safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's completely insulated. I've got my top men on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid, Derek, Hallie, Mickey, and Joel lounge among pillows and blankets. The remains of a sleepover. Joel parts the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two plains clothed policemen are in view, milling about outside - standing guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many guys they have on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie reads from a notebook in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you're sure about skipping Calculas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I have the perfect excuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll cover you through rehearsal. Derek when do you get outta docu- drama?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And watch her til 8:00 - I've got to edit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. I'll be outta Micro-bio and we can grab a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, guys, I'm sorry but, no way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Mickey, you and I can take her late evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is exactly what I don't want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's out of your control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek puts his arms around her, pulling her close. Mickey and Hallie argue about this evening. Joel moves out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My screwed up life shouldn't have to bleed onto my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your film? Isn't it due next week? Have you even started it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge one-stop for students. Comprised of several open floors, it looks like a mini-mall. A cafeteria, book store, movie theatre, arcade, etc. fill the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale moves through the lobby area when she sees Debbie Salt heading her off. She tries to bolt but she's not fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And are the police sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already did. He's the perfect suspect, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parents are always responsible. It all starts in the home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know you kinda hold me up as your career template and it gives you some anal charge to challenge me but you win. Okay? I'm not interested in the scoop anymore. Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale charges off, moving to a nearby newsstand. The tabloid papers exploit what's going on. Crazy headlines about the murders dominate the newsrack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale is clearly bothered by this. Just then, a phone RINGS. She pulls it from her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Killer. His voice is unmistakable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale knows immediately. She looks around for help. A CAMPUS COP is across the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the way we play the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if your life depended on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale stops cold. She looks around. The place is alive with people. He could be anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues moving to the Campus Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deadly warning. Gale stops. She plays it cool. She looks above her to the upper floor. STUDENTS hang over a balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what you want from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are writing another book, aren't you? That's why you're here. The story's not over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Gale, I'm just getting started. Seeya soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK. The phone goes dead. Gale spins around, doing quick circle to make sure no one's around her. She turns and heads off, right into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large tiered theatre. Seats five-hundred. Old but preserved and updated. A rehearsal is in progress. SEVERAL ACTORS stand stage center running lines as stagehands work on the set around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is one of them. She moves around the stage, very animated. More alive than ever. She dons a Russian accent. Convincing. A promising actress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence. Everyone looks at each other. Finally, Lois, the bitchy sorority girl speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the line. You jumped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The actors break up as Sidney, frustrated, walks across a make shift bridge that takes her across the orchestra pit and down the stairs into the house where Hallie sits watching. Sid's bodyguards can be seen sitting scattered about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid, why don't you get outta here? We'll pick this up tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid nods in agreement. The Director smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs her things and heads off with Hallie when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid turns to find Randy moving through an aisle. He had been watching rehearsal. Sid's face tenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Look, Hallie, I'll meet you outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, girletta, I don't leave your side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got my entourage. Take a break. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid is definite. Hallie backs off, heading up the aisle, against her better wishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Sid, please. I never should have gone along with Gale. I know I'm stupid. I wish I had some good reason to give you but I'm just stupid. Please, Sid, don't be mad at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you work for her now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah... she gave me a job. Freelance. It got me outta Woodsboro. I'm sorry about Cotton and yesterday. It was a bad idea. I knew it was a bad idea but it seemed like a quasi harmless bad idea. Ah, shit, Sid, I'm fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney looks at him Long and hard, a smile slowly appearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale and Dewey are with Captain Tyler and Sheriff Evans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he calls again - find help. Don't engage him in conversation. I'm gonna put a man on you - to cover you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Dewey, but I was thinking I'd pull Jesse off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyler doesn't argue. He's too crazed. Dewey avoids Gale's stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37 usages of Himbry located in the registar's office. 9 Tatum's, 47 Riley's. And that's just on campus. It's hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A movie is in progress. STAB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young girl, looking a lot like Tori Spelling, runs down a school corridor. She runs smack into a young, handsome boy. He could very well be Johnny Depp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, Billy, you scared me. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They let me go, Sid, I didn't do it. I'm innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid and Randy sit in the small cineplex mall type theatre. Behind them sit Sid's trusting police guards. Sidney shifts in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tori Spelling and Johnny Depp continue their dramatic discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When my mom left my dad, I accepted it. That's just the way the cookie crumbles. Moms leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but your mom left town. She's not dead. My mom's dead. Do you hear me? She's dead. Dead. And she's never coming back. Ever, Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey, Joel, and Derek are crowded around a table in the Student Union Cafeteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My documentary is due on Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should of done it on Sidney. That would have been a cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with Primetime Live and 20/20 coming at her. I'd save my shit too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damned if I know. She ditched me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't supposed to leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say she was alone. That guy - from her home town showed up. They went off together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie plops down, giving Mickey a big kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been waiting for you, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that cool? Just to leave her like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy Meeks. He was with Sid that night in Woodsboro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she killed her boyfriend. Randy was a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to kill her first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was for a while. Gave it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know so much about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we be worried about this guy? Isn't it kinda weird he just showed up and now people are dying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't most serial killers seemingly harmless?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's documented. Most serial killers are attractive - slightly off white males in their twenties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a surprise for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, he leaps up on the cafeteria table and begins to sing at the top of his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "If I should stay. I would only be in your way. So I'll go. And yet, I know, I'll think of you each step of the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And IIIIIIIIIYEIIIII will always love you OOOOOOWUOOOOOOOO will always love you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has taken notice. They begin to cheer and sing with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And I hope life treats you kind and I hope you have all you dreamed of offffff. I wish you JOYYY."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie can't help but be touched. He finishes up, ending on a last, final note. As he does, he pulls a necklace from around his neck. His Greek letters dangle from it. He places them around her neck, kissing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie breaks away. She swats him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to get it. You know what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I love you. And I want the whole world to know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie smiles, her eyes misty. Derek and Joel eye each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid and Randy continue watching the movie. The guards behind them are way engrossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the end of the movie. Tori Spelling is running for her life from two killers - Johnny Depp and his sidekick. She finds herself trapped in the kitchen. Johnny Depp holds the knife up to Tori's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you kill my mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she was sleeping with my dad. She's the reason my mom left. She was a whore just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These words sting Sid. Randy notices her flinching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom was no whore. Don't you say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears find their way down Sidney's cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Depp and his murderous sidekick start stabbing each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney can't take it anymore. She gets up and races out of the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid emerges from the theatre and into the lobby. She moves into a curtained section where the water fountain is. She looks up and sees Randy flying out of the theatre. He exits outside looking for her. The cops are right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney spins around. Cotton Weary stands before her. shoulders slumped, his face pained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, yesterday wasn't my idea. That was all Gale and dollar signs and ratings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me, Cotton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could start with an apology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wrote me a letter. Very cordial. Very appropriate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? What could I say that would make a difference? I took away a year of your life - how do I apologize for that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish it was just a year. I lost everything because of you. I have nothing now. Look at me, this is what I've become.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silence. Sidney is hanging on by threads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotton, there isn't one day, one hour, one minute when I'm not reminded of what I've done. I have not had one second of reprieve and no therapy or religion or spiritual plane can ever erase what I feel in every vein of my being. And I wish I had in me what you need to hear but I don't think the words exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought if I saw you face to face, maybe it would help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It helped me realize one thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a self-obsessed little cunt like your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Cotton flips on a dime. His face turns evil. Sidney races by him as he throws out his arm, stopping her just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appear, grabbing him from behind. They throw him against the wall, retaining him. Randy appears at Sid's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid nods as she watches the officers arrest him. They do a body search, pulling from his coat a large revolver. Cotton just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid and Randy walk up the steps to the school library. The ever helping guards behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't think Cotton did it. It's too predictable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's innocent he'll have an alibi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess Gale's going to be pissed she missed her exclusive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll relay it. You sure you don't wanna go home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have this button I press. See? It insulates me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She mimes an air lock valve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta coupla of those buttons myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something sad about this exchange. These two people understand each other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime. Sorry it sucked. It just had that been there done that feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney watches as Randy shoves off, disappearing across campus. Sid turns to find Derek leaning against a pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had the four o'clock shift. You weren't there. You had us worried. Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know what happened in Woodsboro, Sid. But I know you don't trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not you, Derek. I don't trust myself. I tend to make big selection errors when it comes to men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll make this easy for you. I like you. I'm crazy about you, Sid. But I'm gonna stay away. Until you say otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long moment. He looks at her, hoping she'll say otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek nods. So that's how it's going to be. He turns and wanders off, not looking back once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The newsvan is parked at a curb. It sits out of the way overlooking the student commons area. A grassy area where students sit and conjugate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale walks back and forth with the cellular attached to her ear. Dewey sits leans against the van, watching her. He still has a crush but hides it as best he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interview's not going to happen. 1 changed my mind. I've harassed the girl enough. It's in poor taste and a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your entire career is in poor taste...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go, call me when you have something nice to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale hangs up, she looks to Dewey. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what made you change your mind about Sidney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a hard one to figure out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that complex yet shallow quality. It's deliberate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're all an act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And deep down I'm a good person? Make no mistake, Dewey, I'm a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also know that you're an aging TV reporter slash writer who, despite huge tabloid success, has some self worth issues regarding your personal life which directly effects your professional life in a non-positive manner. A coupla failed relationships with - I'm guessing balding, older men - have turned you into this bitch with a cell phone. But I bet sometimes, late at night, when you're all alone a sadness seeps to the surface and in a moment of clarity you know that all you really want is to be touched and held and fondled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale stares at him, stunned. A moment as the tension swirls about them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where did you gain all of your Gale Weather's insight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey approaches her. Gale has never been more taken with him. They stand incredibly close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After my spinal cord was damaged I was laid up for over a year. A lot can happen when you're on your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're nearly touching now. Just then, Randy approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale backs away from Dewey, breathless. Her cellular phone RINGS. She eyes Dewey, then hands it to Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's standing right next to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Randy motions to Gale and Dewey. It's him. He points around campus, mouthing "He's watching." Gale grabs Dewey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale and Dewey race off, across the grassy area where STUDENTS come and go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the phone, scared, not knowing what to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... what's your favorite scary movie? No response. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy eyes Dewey and Gale, they move through Students, searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you care? Let 'em have their fun. So, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOWGIRLS. Absolutely frightening. What's yours? Wait, let me guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to be nearby. He likes the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
