dialogues.text: Dewey is on the his walkie. "I need back-up." He has a hard time keeping up with Gale. He hobbles along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes on a tirade pacing back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your deal? Can we talk openly for a second? How does one become a serial killer? Huh? Are you psychopathic or merely psychotic? And what is the distinguishing feature'? Were you slapped around as a child? Is it hereditary? Did your Mom take test drugs? You know, have you tried getting laid? It's done wonders for my homicidal tendencies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, let me think. "Do you want to... " Is that the best you can do? Some tired hand me down rehash? Hey, pal, no one's gonna write a book about you. No movie rights. Nothing. I've been through this before and much better I might add.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale spots a YOUNG MAN, sitting with some other KIDS. He's talking on a cellular phone. She races to him and rips it from his hands. He leaps up ready to pounce on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy won't let up. He continues dissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you're such a brilliant smart killer - why copycat? Why not be original? Where's the innovation? Let's pioneer some new ground. Make a statement. Go down in history. Now you'll always be the Woodsboro copycat killer. That's lame. It's like a bad sequel. And why Woodsboro? What about Manson, Bundy, Son of Sam? Why imitate two high school loser- ass dickheads - 1 knew the guys. Stu was a wussy ass wet rag and Billy - jesus - what a rat-looking homo-repressed, mama's boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the newsvan door RIPS OPEN, a GHOST MASKED FIGURE lunges out grabbing Randy by the neck. The move is quick and precise. A hard yank and Randy is wrenched back into the newsvan. The door SLAMS shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they run back to the newsvan. SIRENS are heard in the distant. Gale races up to find Randy nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy? Randy? Where did he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey circles the van as Gale moves to the sliding side door. She tears it open as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDY'S BODY FALLS OUT. Blood everywhere. His throat slit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale's SCREAM is heard all over campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow tape has been placed around the newsvan. People have gathered as Randy's body is taken out on a stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Tyler and Sheriff Hartley share frustrated faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure about this two person thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broad daylight, a crowded movie theatre. This is too much fun for one person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would say we are now officially baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Hartley looks up as REPORTERS flock them, surrounding them in questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room of the library sectioned off exclusively for computer use. It consists of thirty to forty cubicles that house computer terminals. Every cubicle is full. The place is packed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid sits at a terminal busy at work. Her two police guards wander up and down the cubicles keeping an eye out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face appears concentrated, focused. She scans the computer screen in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid is typing feverishly. Suddenly, her screen starts flashing and BEEPING, freezing her words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, she tries to make it stop but it won't. She leans back, turning to the GUY next to her. A handsome young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Did your computer just freeze?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy leans over and takes a look at Sid's monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have an instant message, that's all. Just hit ALT M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone here in the room. All the terminals are connected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy returns to his own computer. Sidney eyes the screen suspiciously. She hits ALT + M. A message pops up on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney freaks. A muffled CRY. She shoots up, looking about the crowded room. He could be anywhere. The two guards take notice, rushing over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here. He's in the room right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the screen. The men instantly break up and cover the room. They start pulling people from their terminals to check their screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney backs away from her screen, her terror growing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, it starts flashing and BEEPING again. She looks around. She slowly moves toward it, drawn uncontrollably. She hits ALT + M. Another message pops up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's stone pale. She takes a deep breath and begins to type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words "FUCK YOU" appear. Sid hits "SEND".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Tyler and Sheriff Hartley are drilling a very subdued and cool Cotton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What better alibi could I have? I was here in custody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you attack Sidney Prescott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no attack, we were talking. Very heatedly. Miss Prescott and I have a very complicated past. That's no crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a permit. It's registered. I have a legal right to carry it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you need a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, your growing hysteria is not reason enough to hold me here. I've been down this road before. And unless you're going to charge me with a crime I'd like to walk outta here. I have an interview at 6:00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale sits at a table. Dewey approaches. He places a hand on her shoulder. They're both at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, the Sheriff and Captain emerge from their office. Cotton is escorted out behind them. Gale moves to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we got pressure from California State. The man practically has clemency. We can't run the risk of falsely accusing him. He has to be standing over the victim with knife in hand before we make a move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands at a counter, signing forms. Gale approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the story, Gale. Man falsely accused, sent to prison, proved innocent, released back into the real world and never trusted again. Want the exclusive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks him dead in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Gale, you were so instrumental in my freedom. You're not having character doubts now, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a right to be angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Gale, I don't have any rights. You made sure of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotton, I've done nothing but help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done nothing but get rich off of me. How many books have you sold, Gale? You think I don't understand points and royalties and ancilliary rights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, the OFFICER behind the counter brings him his gun in a plastic bag. Cotton takes it out and checks it over. Gale is surprised to see the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do anything stupid, Cotton. You've come to far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale, I don't know what I'm doing from one moment to the next. I'm just taking it as it comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotton pockets the gun and heads out. Gale rejoins Dewey and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night's coming. I think its time to beef up security on the Prescott girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was just escorted to her dorm room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to bring her in. Hide her out for a coupla days. And we're issuing a campus lock-in this evening. No one is allowed out after dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just isolating people. You're giving the killer a blank canvas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day turns to night and college life comes to a deadly stand still as everyone observes the imposed campus restrictions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fraternity house sits dark and quiet. A YOUNG MAN walks up the walk to the front door. He TAPS on it three times and it quietly opens as he's ushered in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young man makes his way down a long hallway, down a spiral staircase, through a thick basement door and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music peels paint as YOUNG COLLEGE STUDENTS rock to deafening tunes. A row of kegs line one wall as a the party gears up for a drunken night ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek is seen with his video camera. He's filming Lois and Murphy. They talk into the camera. Both tipsy chatty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all about sisterhood. Everybody thinks its about partying and blowjobs but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... we only promote safe rubbered sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it's really about family and tradition...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just love being a sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey approaches as Derek finishes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take off to the kegs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they aware of your not so positive portrayal of Greek life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek shrugs. He's clearly upset by it when from out of nowhere, SEVERAL FRAT BOYS appear, picking Mickey up, lifting him over their heads. Everyone starts CHEERING and CLAPPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They carry him around the room, CHANTING. The frat boys abduct Mickey, taking him up the stairs and out sight. Others lookie loo's follow. Derek grabs his camera and bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is trying to focus on homework while Hallie channel surfs. She finds a channel. On screen, Siskel a Ebert are reviewing a movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're missing the Sig Ep party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Hallie, not tonight. Parties and mass murderers don't go together. Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I hadn't planned on going, it's just Mickey will be pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie clearly wishes she were there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just an excuse to kill young, big breasted girls. I didn't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're reviewing STAB. Hallie switches channels. There's a KNOCK on the door. Sid answers - it's Dewey and Gale. From the look on their faces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLAT! Gobs of gooey food goes flying through the air exploding perfectly all over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who stands buck naked, tied... chained to a tree in the back yard. The yard is crowded with FRAT BOYS and SORORITY GIRLS who delight in torching him. Mounds of syrup, eggs, and other wet and slimy food is plunged upon him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More food and slime come barreling at him. A drunk Lois and Murphy pull the police tape down from the previous night's crime scene and begin to Mayflower him. The crowd goes crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie consoles Sidney. Dewey and Gale nearby. Sidney is a stone rock. It's frightening to watch her hold it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. I wish people would stop treating me like glass. I'm not gonna break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay to break, girl. You shatter if you have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd really just like to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are waiting outside. They're going to take you somewhere safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney starts packing an overnight bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Hallie, I'm not gonna take you down too. I'll be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But who would operate your camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burn. It comes out of nowhere. Gale goes silent. A KNOCK at the door. Dewey opens to find a Police guard standing with Joel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joel is ushered in. He says his hello's, moving to Hallie. Gale and Dewey move out into the hall with the guards. Sid continues to pack. Her face rigid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got Mickey. He's being toasted at the Deltas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. Shit! I gotta get over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to Dewey who talks to Gale in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the only one who can cut him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a good idea, Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives Sidney a hug before she can object, then she and Joel race out into the hallway as Dewey sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Joel and Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie forgot her footage at the film dept. I'm gonna walk her over before it's gets too late

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie and Joel race outta there before any more objections. Dewey turns to Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were truly a copycat, wouldn't you want to emulate everything about the killer that you could?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's already gotta be a part of Sid's life. What do you know about this Derek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solid alibis. He was with Sidney when she was attacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey turns to Sid who now stands ready in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I got stuff to do. But I'll find you later, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey is still tied to the tree. He's so completely covered in hardened gook it looks like he's wearing clothes. The last of the crowd has left. They've gone back to the party. He stands shivering in the cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks the chain that holds him secure. It's composed of several bike locks and steel twine. He's not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMP! He hears a noise. He looks to the nearby shrubs and beyond. Nothing. Just a noise of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark room. A slight disturbance at the door and it comes popping open. Light from the hall floods the room as Dewey and Gale slip in and close the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bloody knife. A ghost mask. Something like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we turn the light on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the way it's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey pulls out his flashlight and begins to search the room. He sifts through drawers and a closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's sexier in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey, you and I would never make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not. But think about the sex. As frustrated as I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and as lonely as I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale LAUGHS at this. She reaches over and pats his buttock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what. We get through this one. And we'll take out a hotel room. Over here with the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey points the light to a framed picture. It's of Joel and Derek - a buddy pose. She sifts through some text books on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sorority girl was gutted with autopsy precision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! It's both of them. The first murders were to throw us - using the same names as Woodsboro. But they've moved on - they're getting closer to Sidney. They're not looking for a Himbry or a Tatum to kill. They're looking for the new Tatum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment. Then in a splash, they're outta there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A squad car makes it's way down the quiet campus street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney sits in the backseat. The two police officers ride in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're meeting another car that will transport you the rest of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car comes to a halt in front of a stop light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney smiles at this just as the car door rips open on the passenger's side. Two hands reach in and yank Police Guard #2 from the car. He starts to CRY OUT but it's cut short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid SCREAMS as the Police Guard behind the wheel struggles with his seat belt. He looks up to see a Ghost Masked Figure move around the side of the car towards his door. He reaches for his gun but it's too late. The Ghost has the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flash of silver and the Police Guard's throat is slit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney SCREAMS and SCREAMS, BEATING on the door of the car. It won't open. She's trapped like a caged animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost pulls the Police Guard from the car, then gets in, behind the driver's seat. The Ghost puts the car in drive and takes off down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney looks behind her as the guard's dead bodies lay sprawled in the middle of the road. She turns to the door, BEATING and CLAWING at it. She leans back, manic, and KICKS at the window with her feet. No use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car makes its way down the deserted street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is beyond frantic. She eyes the Ghost through the gate. She turns and twists looking for an escape. Through the window, she sees approaching headlights. She SCREAMS through the closed window as a car passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney takes notice as the car turns onto another campus street. Big, stone school buildings line each side of a thin, road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She eyes the Ghost through the rearview window. The white masks turns as hidden eyes bore through her. The Ghost hits the gas, picking up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney looks to the book bag on the seat beside her. She rips it open, rustling through it frantically. She pulls books, pencils, paper... Sid grabs a long, yellow No.2 pencil. She grips it hard, looking to the metal grate just behind the driver's seat. The Ghost's neck is right up against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid takes the pencil and positions it right behind the Ghost's head, ready to attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without pause, Sid RAMS the pencil through the grate, into the Ghost's neck. It lodges there as the Ghost falls forward in pain, losing control of the wheel for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car jumps the curb and SLAMS against a building. The Ghost yanks the wheel, over correcting. He tries to bring it back to the road but doesn't see the lamp post that stands directly in the car's path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Squad car makes direct contact with the lamp post, SLAMMING into it, bringing the car to a CRASHING HALT, lodging it agaisnt the building's stone exterior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke rises from a bashed engine as it emits a fatal rumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is still. In the backseat, Sidney rises from the floorboards. She looks up to see the Ghost Masked figure slumped over the steering wheel. Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid quickly pulls herself together, looking about, sizing up her options. She tugs on the door handle. It won't budge. She looks to the passenger's side of the car. It's flush against the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she notices the metal grate. The edge has been pried apart in the crash. Sidney reaches for it, pulling on it, bending it backwards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid tries to stifle the noise it makes, all the while eyeing the Ghost who remains unconscious. She creates an opening large enough for her to crawl through. She lifts herself up and pulls herself through to the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid falls down into the seat, her eyes never leaving the Ghost. She lay crumpled up against the smashed passenger's door, the only sound is her own TERRIFIED BREATHING. She watches the Ghost Masked Figure. His body doesn't move. She contemplates her next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only way out is through the driver's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After what seems an eternity, she slowly reaches over with her foot and nudges the Ghost. No movement. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slides across the seat towards the Ghost, moving to his side. She reaches with her hand and pushes on the Ghost's shoulder. His body moves, slumping back against the back of the seat. It clears space for her to pass through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits up on her feet, facing the Ghost. With her leg, she reaches over him, straddling him. She leans against the steering wheel, her arm quickly reaching for the door knob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her back brushes against the horn. Sid TENSES, her face a little more than a foot from the Ghost Mask. He doesn't move. He's completely out cold. Sid pushes the car door open and starts to slide completely over the Ghost when she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she fights with a decision. Then, with a fierce determination, Sid reaches for the Ghost Mask. She finds the edge and begins to peels the Mask away when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunging forward. Sidney SCREAMS, leaping, falling out the car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid hits the pavement hard. She lifts herself up when her entire body is YANKED VIOLENTLY BACKWARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost has hold of her foot, pulling her back into the car. Sidney KICKS and WRITHES breaking free. She hops to her feet as the Ghost emerges from the car. Sidney SLAMS the car door shut. It catches the Ghost, knocking him backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid tears off, down the street, running, burning up the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The film school sits in the still darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey and Gale move down a dark and shadowed hallway. THUMP! They stop cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey has lead her to a door marked "LECTURE HALL".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same room seen earlier. A large, rounded room with three levels of seats that shoot straight up to the ceiling. A podium stands center. Video monitors hang from the ceiling in different places around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey and Gale enter. If not for the red EXIT SIGNS that hang over the exit doors, the room would be completely dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move down the first level of chairs to the lecturn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they never got here. He could have taken her anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK! STATIC! A noise from above takes their attention. They looks up as a video monitor comes to life. Images appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home-made video footage fills the screen. A movie theatre, people standing in line. The home camera ZOOMS in to a YOUNG COUPLE. Maureen and Phil come into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale watches the screen as Dewey looks around the room, searching for it's source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK! Another monitor comes to life. More home shot video footage. This time of a big house. A closer look reveals it to be the Chi Omega Sorority House. A young girl stands on the front porch talking on a portable phone. It's Cici.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Randy standing outside the newsvan with the cellular phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK! Another monitor turns on. It's of a man and woman back to the camera. The couple move in frame. It becomes apparent quick. It's Gale and Dewey. As they stand in the room - live. They're being taped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey spins around. He reaches for the gun he no longer carries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around the room, up to the two levels above them. He spots a small light on the second level. He squints his eyes and sees a FIGURE standing behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey hands her his flashlight and takes off for the stair rise that leads to the upper level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Dewey, let's call for backup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Dewey is gone, leaving Gale alone. She turns to the monitor to see her face in fear-stricken CLOSEUP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey moves fast, limping his way to the level's edge. He approaches the railing and makes his way around to the shining light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches it, finding nothing but a camera and tripod. It sits alone against the railing. Dewey surveys the second level. Empty seats everywhere. Completely bare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey looks down to the main floor... to Gale who looks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey turns to leave, his eye catching a monitor that hangs level with the railing. On the monitor, Gale is in frame, looking up at Dewey, her face fear stained. She takes a step forward, moving out of frame, revealing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who stands right behind her. Dewey looks down to see the Ghost standing directly behind Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale turns just in time to see the gleam of a killer's knife as it darts out of the darkness. Gale catapults, just dodging it. She moves like lightning up the aisle of seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey races for the stairs, going as fast as his handicapped leg will allow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale tears out the exit door, the Killer right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey arrives, searching, looking for Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eyes the exit door as it slowly closes. He moves for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale races down the hallway, eyeing the nearest door. She tears it open, disappearing into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale finds herself in the student studios. She stands in a huge control booth that overlooks a dubbing stage. Lots of glass walls and doors. It has a maze quality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale moves out a side door and into a dubbing room. Darkness everywhere Gale stops for a second, listening as she main door CREAKS open. And then FOOTSTEPS are heard, making their way towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale proceeds deeper into the studio. She moves into a sound proof room and closes the door. Not seeing the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stands behind her. She turns around and SCREAMS. She starts out, but then realizes he's standing in the control booth. She's protected by a clear, large, plexiglass window that wraps around the room. The ghost moves out the side door, heading her way. He disappears out of view. Gale freaks. She races to the door, trying to secure it. There's no lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey slips through quietly, trying his best to be quick on his toes. Through the control booth window, he immediately spots Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale looks for objects to block the door with. She drags a shelf of sound equipment towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't hear him. The room is sound proof. He BEATS against the glass. Still, she doesn't turn to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale shoves everything she can find against the door, not seeing or hearing Dewey as he POUNDS against the sound proof barrier behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She also doesn't see the Killer that appears behind Dewey. He moves on him swift and focused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale can't take her eyes off the door. Her face is terrified. If she'd only turn around, she would see Dewey - his face terror stricken as a knife is hurled into him repeatedely. With each thrust, blood is splattered against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey SCREAMS for his life, caught completely off guard. He falls forward onto the control panels. Suddenly, microphone feedback tears through the studios as Dewey's CRIES are heard throughout the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey's DEATH SCREAM rips through the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale turns to the window to see Dewey, his face smashed against it, blood smeared across the glass. She moves to the window, her face only inches from his. A moment as their eyes meet. Dewey's life is near gone. His eyes reveal it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale BEATS against the glass window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewey's body slides down, out of view. Gale is mortified. She looks to the Killer who has already made his way through the control booth. He's coming for her. She races to the door, throws the things away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She manages to pull the door open just enough to slide through. And she's off and running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale finds a door and plows through it, stopping only long enough to lock it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! The Ghost RAMS it from the other side but it holds. Gale surveys her surroundings. She's in a storage room. She eyes another door. She moves through it and out into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney races down the deserted street. Not a soul in sight. She reaches a corner, moves off the road and passes through a series of trees and shrubs, coming out onto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The houses have long since gone to sleep. The Delta Zeta House stares at Sidney. Lights burn from within. Sid goes for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid makes her way up the front porch. She POUNDS on the front door, SCREAMING her lungs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid wastes no time, she moves along the wraparound porch, beating at the windows. But nothing. Everybody is off partying. Suddenly, Sid hears something. A WHIMPERING. She turns to find Murphy and Lois, laying, strewn across the end of the porch. Passed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, help me. We have to call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid kneels over Murphy, shaking her. Murphy's eyes open and she GIGGLES. The girl is completely wasted. She has no comprehension skills at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have keys? I need to get inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid looks to Lois. She's in worse shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid contemplates, not knowing what to do. She leaves them, moving down off the porch and around to the back of the house. She gets to the back door, tries it. It's locked too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney checks out the yard. Off to the side, she spots a big tree with a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BODY, lying next to it in a heap on the ground She moves toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sid approaches she sees clearly that it's Mickey. He lay on his side, curled, knees to chest, his arm still chained to the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of dread creeps across her face. He lay there very much dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kneels over his body just as it stirs, lifting up, rising. Mickey's face comes into view, coated in dried funk, his eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid? Jesus, where's Hallie? I've been here all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. We've got to get help. The Killer's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey pulls on his chained arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! You've got to cut me down, Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid inspects the chain. It's meant to hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney moves to the shed that's attached to the garage. Leaning against the side are a row of garden tools. Sid settles on a shovel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid returns to Mickey who has risen to his feet. He's pulling and twisting the bike chain that binds him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid lifts the shovel up and brings it down directly on the lock. It bends somewhat but stays in tact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLANK! A noise behind them. They both spin around peering into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, determined, raises the shovel high and brings it down with great force. It CRACKS the lock, loosening it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey pulls on it. It won't quite give.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid raises the shovel again, unfaltering. She doesn't see the Ghost Masked Figure that slides down from the tree branch behind her. The Figure moves quickly and gracefully, coming to a stance directly behind Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey looks up, just in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid turns just as the Killer strikes. But Sid is ready. Without thought, she swings the shovel at the Ghost, catching his mid-section, sending him flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey goes ballistic chained to the tree. He pulls, twists, squirms... anything to free himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost rises, moving on Mickey. Sidney sees this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney distracts the Ghost. She takes off, the Ghost following her. She moves around the tree, sprinting across the yard, running smack into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sidney spins around as two Ghosts appear on each side of her. She stands THUNDERSTRUCK as the two Killers descend on her. She dives between the two but they counter, keeping her surrounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid watches as one of the Ghosts withdraws his knife. She turns to the other. His knife is already poised. They close in on her, ready to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks for an escape. There's not one. BAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Mickey appears, barreling into one of the Ghosts. They go sprawling across the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney makes her break, she runs passed them, towards the front of the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey leaps to his feat. The Killer right behind him. He now finds himself in Sid's predicament. He doesn't know where to run. The two Killer's close in on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney gets to the corner of the house. She stops... she doesn't want to leave Mickey. She turns back around just in time to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey sandwiched in between the two Ghosts. They're knives strike at the same time. One through the stomach, the other through the back. They withdraw their knives. Mickey's body suspends, momentarily hanging in the air. Then collapses to a heap on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Ghosts turn to Sid at the same time. She takes off running, along the side of the house, through a row of shrub that take her to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid is back on the campus street, running down the middle of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots a car stopped at a red light half a block up. KIDS are inside, rock music BLARES. Sid SCREAMS and SCREAMS but they don't hear her. She runs, feet pounding, toward them but the light turns green and the car takes off. It's taillights fading in the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns finding herself alone in a parking lot. The theatre sits in the distance. She spots someone entering the theatre. It looks like Hallie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Hallie doesn't hear her. Sid races forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale races down the empty campus street. She eyes an emergency phone that's attached to a street lamp. She goes for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale rips the phone from its cradle, presses the CALL button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's trying to kill me. I need the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay under the safety light. Help is on its way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Gale hears a NOISE. A door opening. She looks up to see Sidney disappear through the side theatre door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sidney has already disappeared inside. Gale yells into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale throws the phone down and tears off for Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The theatre is big and old. Plush chairs, balcony, huge proscenium stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney enters through a side house door. She pulls on it, releasing the emeregency lock. She makes her way down the aisle toward the orchestra section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stage is dark and bare with the exceptions of the furniture from the DEATHTRAP set. BUMP! A noise from the stage wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney moves down front to the little bridge that extends out over the orchestra pit. She crosses it and moves to stage center, peering into the wings on either side of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something drips down from above and onto Sidney. She wipes it from her face when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK! A spot light turns on from the back of the house, illuminating Sid center stage. She jumps at this, unnerved. She looks to her hand, covered in crimson. Then out to the house... the light is blinding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLANK! A NOISE from above..ropes, pulleys moving. Sid looks up as a set wall comes PLOWING down at her. She leaps out of the way, falling to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall falls into place on the stage. It is the back wall of the set that's dressed with framed pictures and antique weapons and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who hangs from it, pinned up against the wall, very much deadk, arms outstretched, crucified. His body a bloody mess. Sidney stops, stunned. She stands frozen in unspeakable horror. Her entire being ripped apart. She breaks into tears. And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid backs up, moving, racing toward the wings when another wall flies in, sealing the backstage area off, trapping her. She looks in shock at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strung up, her body hanging lifeless. Sid SCREAMS, turning, running to the other side of the stage when a third wall comes flying in, creating the three walled set of DEATHTRAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attached to it, is the body of Joel. Dead. Blood everywhere. And then, Sid hears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single pair of hands from somewhere in the house... applauding. She turns around and spots a FIGURE moving down the aisle. She can't make out who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid bolts. She spots the set door up center, near Dewey's body. She goes for it, ripping it open to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid SCREAMS. But then sees his face, he looks scared. And then, Cotton's body falls forward to the floor, his arms and legs bound by electric tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid turns back to the front of the stage. The Figure is now walking across the bridge, holding something... a light attached to a video camera. She's being filmed. Sid looks back to Cotton who looks up to her with pleading eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid is paniced. She doesn't know what to do. She leans down to untie him but stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've seen this movie before, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney looks to the voice. The camera is pulled away to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Side backs away from Cotton. She doesn't trust either one of them. Derek watches her, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. This is a set up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Sidney, he's going to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be dealing with some serious trust issues right about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney says nothing. She egdes away, moving to the wall where Hallie hangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, you can't keep your back to the audience like that. Could you cheat a little forward for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really stumped, aren't you? You know there's two killers but you don't know who they are. I'm a given. The boyfriend. Way obvious. But now you're torn. Everyone else appears to be dead. Except for Cotton. Hmmm? Hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Hallie comes to life behind Sid, reaching out, grabbing her. Sid JUMPS. She spins around to find Hallie breaking out in a torrent of GIGGLES. Very much alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paaaaiiin... yah, such pain... The story of your life, Sid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney stares in mortal shock as Hallie cuts herself down from the wall with a big hunting knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney's eyes go back and forth between the two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should really see your face right now, Sid. It's doing some freaky shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek's right. Sid's face appears completely tortured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you look quizzical yet pensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, how can we help? Do you have any questions regarding the sequel of your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney stares them down. She's been here before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question. You took the bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever see NATURAL BORN KILLERS? Well, Derek and I have this whole Mickey/Mallory-Woody Harrelson/Juliette Lewis thing going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't like that comparison, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Sid, don't fade on us. We've been planning this baby for a year. Humor us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid turns to Cotton. She kneels down and begins to untie him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek dummy lunges at her with the knife. Sid backs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale approaches the side theatre door. She pulls on it. It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves down along the theatre to another door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallie and Derek move around Sid, taking turns filming her with the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sent me the cutest e-mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read her postings on the horror movie chat boards and fell hopelessly. Hook, line...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have our own website now. We dedicated a whole page to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd me amazed at how many of us there are out there. It's a whole world, Sid. You're really popular amongst the demented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who got away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually Cotton, and I think critics would agree, it's the other way around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Cotton, could life be a little more cruel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to get away with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. Who wants to? What's the point if we don't get caught? Where's the glamour in that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way I see it. We'll be arrested. Go to prison. Cash in on the home footage. Secure a book deal. If all goes as planned, our trial should coincide with the release of STAB II.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A verdict and premiere all on the same day. I love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hoping for the death penalty. I have this whole DEAD MAN WALKING swan song exit planned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope you're ready, Sid. We got one last surprise for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotton pull and twists on his bound wrists. Sid had loosened them somewhat. He tries to finish undoing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A twist ending if you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we really had our work cut out for us. It really is the curse of the sequel. The Billy/Stu thing's been done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... so we had to be different but yet the same because if you venture to far away from your orginal story you completely alienate the audience...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we didn't want to do that, Sid. We wanted to give you your money's worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a surprise guest star waiting in the wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a sec, Derek. We forgot to flip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek reaches in his pocket for a coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We figure the one of us that actually kills you will get a little more press. It's been an ongoing discussion. (to Hallie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale emerges from the lobby. She found a way in. She eyes the proceedings on stage. She sees Sidney standing over Cotton. And then Hallie and Derek on either side... knives in hand. She races down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn, spotting Gale. Sid moves forward, happy to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale moves down the aisle, not sure what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney moves down center. Derek cuts her off just as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale glimpsed the terror on Sidney's face just as the curtain separates them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek grabs Sidney, holding her, the knife at her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about time she showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale moves to the exit door and into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale eyes a door that's marked "STAGE DOOR". She opens it and steps in coming face to face with a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale's eyes move down the end of the gun to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Gale, we've been waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale's face is a mass of confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek releases Sidney, shoving her, she falls to her knees, next to Cotton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, look, you guys - I applaud your methodical expertise but I have a question. What's going to happen after I die? I thought the heroine is supposed to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're trying to send a message to Hollywood. I'm really getting tired of all the happy endings. It's just not reality. In the real world the good guys die, the innocent are punished, and the murderers inherit the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nobody wants to see that. It'll never go. They'll rewrite you. You don't want that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Sid, you're sounding desparate. I guess fearing death makes one anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking freaked out movie nut psychos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't blame the movies, Sid. Movies don't create pyschos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid stops dead in her tracks as these words still her very soul. The Voice comes from the wings. They all turn as Gale Weathers appears. Behind her, with gun in hand, is Debbie Salt. Derek grabs the camera. He doesn't want to miss a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know that by now? It's about family. It all starts at home. It starts with the father... and the mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney mouth drops, her face aghast, as she looks to Debbie Salt. She recognizes her immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you we had a guest star. Didn't see that coming, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's taken on a hyper- reality, hasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't believe you didn't recognize me. You even interviewed me for your book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where should we start? Your mother ruined my marriage by sleeping with my husband. You ruined my family by killing my son. Gale aired it to the world. Should I go on... isn't that enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you're just as whacked as your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think he got it? Mental illness is heriditary. Who do you think incouraged him to kill your mother? He was a smart kid but children need parental guidance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is completely horror stricken. She stands in total disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's been great, Sid. We never would have been able to it without her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie Salt/Mrs. Loomis looks to both Derek and Hallie, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I couldn't have done it without you two. Now who won the coin toss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie points the gun at her, quickly, simply... and FIRES. Sid and Gale SCREAM as a bullet through the forehead sends Hallie flying back against the flat wall. Her body drops to the floor. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek drops the camera, completely taken back. He looks to Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie turns the gun on him. FIRES AGAIN. Derek moves, the bullet catches him in the stomach. He drops to his knees. Debbie FIRES again. Derek takes another bullet. This time dropping. Very dead. His body falls near Cotton who has remained suspiciously quiet through this ordeal. He eyes Derek's knife that now lay near his wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn to Debbie in complete horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice kids but a little out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you'll never get away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it. An innocent man wrongly accused. Spends time in prison where he justs sits with his righteous anger, waiting, planning his revenge. His life so incomprehensively ruined he's forced to take revenge on the people responsible. It's perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Cotton. I guess you were just meant to be a killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never get away with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would you like to shoot first, Cotton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Cotton leans up, freed from his bindings. With the knife in hand, he lunges for Debbie Salt. It strikes her, lodging into her chest. She goes back. Cotton doesn't stop, he stabs her again and again. She goes down. Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale rushes to Cotton as he jumps to his feet. She helps him with the last of his bindings. Sid looks about at the body count on stage. It's mounting. She takes a deep breath. Relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Cotton, what a nightmare. I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs her back. She doesn't see as he rises the knife behind her, bringing it down in one swift, maniacal move. Gale's body jerks, a moment of shock and then she goes limp as the knife lodges in her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney turns just in time to see Cotton toss Gale's body down into the orchestra pit. He turns, facing Sidney. The bloody knife in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotton moves to Derek's body where the video camera lay, he pulls the tape from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfect, Sidney. No one will ever suspect me. I have proof. I'm the victim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the video cassette. Murder in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get my revenge and make some fast cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotton lunges for her. Sid tears off, slipping through the set door to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid runs to the rear of the stage. She moves in the narrow space that exists between the scrim and the back wail. She races down it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She almost reaches the end when COTTON RIPS THROUGH THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney ducks, bypassing him. She comes to the stage door. It's locked. She turns, seeing the metal ladder that's attached to the wall. It leads to the catwalk above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid goes for it. She climbs up the ladder with lightning speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotton, up and running, is close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The catwalk sits above the open fly space where flats and a large chandelier are stored in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sid reaches the top and takes off running down to the ending.
